title: Understanding Arabic Alphabets Saad ( ص ) and Daad ( ض )
headline: Learn how to write, pronounce and different forms of the letters Saad (ص) and Daad (ض) with this free online course.
description: Some people believe Arabic to be the most beautiful written language in the world. It is valued above all other Arab art forms and is considered similar to drawing, painting, or fine arts. With just two modules and eight lectures (and no subscription or registration fees), master the art of writing and enunciating the Arabic letters Saad (ص) and Daad (ض) in this free Arab language course that is suitable for complete beginners.
courseDescription:
One of the languages with a non-Latin alphabet is Arabic. Its scripts are easier to understand for English speakers than others, but it is still a completely new writing system for beginners. What makes reading and writing in Arabic especially challenging for learners is the exclusion of most vowels in words. Arabic is also composed from right to left, which takes some practice to read and write. This specialist course introduces you to the 14th and 15th letters of the Arabic alphabet.

It starts with presenting the letter Saad (ص), the 14th letter. You will discover that the letter Saad has the sound of a strong ‘S’ in English. Next, you will explore the letter Saad (ص) with short and long vowels. In addition, you will learn how to write it depending on its position in the phrase.

The final section explains the 15th letter in Arabic, the letter Daad (ض). It has the sound of ‘D’ in English. You will explore the letter Daad with the short and long vowels, as well as Tanween. Arabic letters can have four different forms corresponding to an initial, middle, or final. Start learning how Saad (ص) and Daad (ض) link to the letter before or after them.
